name: Instant Pot® Hard-Boiled Eggs
author: Eric Belk
summary: Use your Instant Pot® to make perfect hard-boiled eggs every time! The amount of eggs you can cook depends on the size of your eggs--I can usually fit 16, but if your eggs are larger or smaller the amount will vary.
directions: Insert a wire rack in the bottom of a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®)
Carefully place raw eggs onto the rack, fitting them in tightly
Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 4 minutes
Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
As soon as the timer goes off, hit cancel and release the pressure using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes
Unlock and remove the lid, as leaving eggs in longer will result in overcooked eggs
Transfer eggs to a large bowl using a serving spoon and cover with cold water
Peel while still warm and rinse off any shell pieces
Use immediately or store in the fridge
